content.text: Kyle scores 84 marks out of 96 in an examination
Write down the mathematical name for this triangle
Write down the number of lines of symmetry for the triangle
The lengths of each side of this triangle are the same
Work out the number of minutes from 18 27 on Tuesday to 03 19 on Wednesday
Gregor changes \$700 into euros (€) when the rate is €1 = \$1.4131
One bracelet costs 85 cents and one necklace costs \$7.50
Write down an expression, **in dollars**, for the total cost of \(b\) bracelets and \(n\) necklaces
A quadrilateral has four sides of equal length and two pairs of equal angles
Write down the mathematical name for this quadrilateral
Three of the angles in a quadrilateral are \(63^{\circ}\) , \(74^{\circ}\) and \(92^{\circ}\)
Work out the size of the fourth angle
Work out the difference in these temperatures
\(18^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\) is given correct to the nearest degree
Write down the upper bound for this temperature
The temperature at the top of a mountain is \(- 12^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\)
The temperature at the bottom of the mountain is \(18^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\)
Write down all the factors of 15
Using a scale of 1 cm to represent 5 m, construct triangle \(ABC\)
**The construction must be completed using a ruler and compasses only.**
**All construction arcs must be clearly shown.**
Shania invests \$750 at a rate of \(2 \frac{1}{2} \%\) per year simple interest
Calculate the total amount Shania has after 5 years
Without using your calculator, work out \(\frac{1}{6} +\frac{9}{10}\)
You must show your working and give your answer as a mixed number in its simplest form
\(EF\) is a diameter of the circle
Find the value of \(z\) in this isosceles triangle
Write down the co-ordinates of point \(A\)
Find the square root of one million
Make \(x\) the subject of this formula
Draw the locus of points that are \(4\mathrm{cm}\) from \(A\)
Shade the region which is less than \(4\mathrm{cm}\) from \(A\) and nearer to \(B\) than to \(A\)
(a) Using a straight edge and compasses only, construct the perpendicular bisector of \(AB\). Show all your construction arcs.
Write down the only number in the list which is **not** a prime number
